results.title: Punkline
results.creator_credit: Kali Productions, Sue Davis and Tony Stevens
results.brief_description: Shot at the Crystal Ballroom and Festival Hall during performances of the B 52’s, The Cure, La Femme and The Models, this film provides an observation not of the New Wave performers, but of the people who go to see them. Soundtrack from a tape by Equal Local.

results.title: Punk Prayer - Mother of God, Chase Putin Away!
results.brief_description: In 2012, Pussy Riot staged a performance on the soleas of a Moscow cathedral to protest the Orthodox Church’s support of Putin’s election campaign. Though two members were arrested and jailed, the other members of the group made the performance into a music video.

constellations_other.name: Access to resistance
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how access to new recording devices has inspired guerilla filmmaking and protest, helping challenge cultural, societal and political norms.

results.title_for_label: Punk Prayer - Mother of God, Chase Putin Away!
results.description: On 21 February 2012, five members of Pussy Riot staged a performance on the soleas of Moscow’s Cathedral of Christ the Savior. Their actions were stopped by church security officials. By evening, they had turned it into a music video entitled “Punk Prayer - Mother of God, Chase Putin Away!”. The women said their protest was directed at the Orthodox Church leader’s support for Putin during his election campaign.
description_for_label: On 21 February 2012, five members of Pussy Riot staged a performance on the soleas of Moscow’s Cathedral of Christ the Savior. Their actions were stopped by church security officials. By evening, they had turned it into a music video entitled “Punk Prayer - Mother of God, Chase Putin Away!”. The women said their protest was directed at the Orthodox Church leader’s support for Putin during his election campaign.

results.title: Punk in London
results.brief_description: Originally shot in colour 16mm film, this DVD edition has some of the hallmarks of an old print - scratches, pink tinge in the colour and generally dubious quality. But all of this can be forgiven, as the content of the work is a wonderful documentary of live footage of concerts of UK punk bands given in late 1970s London and Germany. Features bands The Clash, The Adverts, The Jam, The Boomtown Rats, The Electric Chairs and others. Includes interviews, shots of street-wear fashion and crowds, including loving audiences pogo-ing with great delight and alcohol fuelled fervour. This film captures the youth of the day and their quest to make themselves seen and heard, singing “Oh Bondage, Up Yours!” Directed by Wolfgang Buld from the Munich Film School. (Please note a small glitch occurs at 00:09:57 min).

results.title: Punk dogs R kool!
results.brief_description: A short film made in a one day ACMI Claymation workshop where students are taught the basics of stop motion animation using modelling clay, a digital video camera and editing software. They also create an original soundtrack for their film

results.title: Punk and its after shocks
results.creator_credit: Gerd Stein, Wolfgang Buld and GRF Productions
results.brief_description: Examines the emergence of punk in Britain during the early 1970’s, the bands that made Punk and the movements that Punk spawned including the ‘New Wave’ movement in music. Interviews band members and musicians who were involved in the punk movement and includes clips of the Sex Pistols, The Clash, The Jam, The Police, Madness, Ian Dury and The Kinks performing live.

results.title: Punitive damage
results.creator_credit: Annie Goldson, Gaylene Preston and Occasional Productions
results.brief_description: Australian Kamal Bamadhaj was shot dead by the Indonesian military during the massacre at Santa Cruz cemetery in Dili in November 1991. A student of History and Indonesian Politics at the University of New South Wales, Bamadhaj was also one of the first foreigners to visit East Timor since the invasion of 1975. He had travelled there to assist in a human rights investigation. In her grief, his mother Helen Todd became determined to avenge her son’s death. She eventually found a way to fight the Indonesian government and those responsible for her son’s killing, in a landmark international court case. As the story unfolds, it becomes not only the tale of a mother’s sorrow, but also testimony to the brutal reality of Indonesia’s military occupation of East Timor.

results.title: Punching keys
results.creator_credit: Sally Ingleton and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A biting dramatisation of the effects of the new technology in deskilling the female office workforce, alienating women from the products of their labour, and rendering them replaceable by cheaper labour overseas. Cast includes a young Gina Riley.

results.title: Punch press guarding
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Campbell and Industrial Accident Prevention Associations
results.brief_description: Shows management and employees that there is a guard to protect workers on every type of punch press and that protection is provided only when the guard is properly adjusted. The punch press has a record of producing more permanent disability injuries than any other industrial mechanical equipment. Shocking accidents are shown followed by examples of guards available and a clear statement of the foreman’s responsibility in preventing accidents.

results.title: Punch-drunk love = Punch drunk love
results.creator_credit: Columbia, Revolution Studios, New Line Cinema, Joanne Sellar, Daniel Lupi and Paul Thomas Anderson
results.brief_description: This is not a typical Adam Sandler comedy. Barry Egan (Sandler) is a novelty business owner who has seven sisters and is looking for love, (even trying phone sex once) but love finds him, sending his very ordered life upside down. Watching “Punch-drunk love” you find a mix of dark humour and seedy characters, coupled with violent behaviour and social dysfunction - but it’s also a romance with colour, mood and music that carries you along and makes you hope for a happy ending. Written and directed by Paul Thomas Anderson, winner of Best Director 2002 Cannes Film Festival for this disquieting film. Cast includes Emily Watson, Philip Seymour Hoffman and Luis Guzman.

results.title: Pumiceland
results.brief_description: The Central Plateau of the North Island of New Zealand was laid waste by a volcanic upheaval 2000 years ago and since then has remained a wasteland. This film tells the story of the attempts and final success of farmers and scientists to make it a productive area.
